Reviews.Content: Great Location We stayed two nights in the hotel. The hotel is in desperate need of updating. The carpet and wallpaper was filthy, so bring slippers. The location is great. It is easy to reach all major sights and very convenient to the train station. We felt very cozy in the rooms and the staff was helpful. A two night stay was fine, had it been longer I don't know. Hotel Rex should spend a little money on paint and carpet because it could be a quaint hotel!
Reviews.Author: mama27g

Reviews.Content: Normal Euro Hotel-great deal! This hotel was a great find. It is a typical older European hotel, meaning it is not perfect. But it was easy to find, centrally located to all major sites and trains, clean and accomodating. This hotel is old, the walls do need a fresh papering (the floors in our back corner room were tiled), but if you are looking for an affordable place to stay, consider this hotel. Although many of the previous reviews were negative, and I was apprehensive, I have no serious complaints. The worse thing I can say is that the tub was small and the bathroom light/fan buzzed annoyingly.
Reviews.Author: isis715

Reviews.Content: Can do better I would like to meet the reviewer who gave this hotel a 3 star rating. Comparing this to other 3 star hotels, 1-2 stars should be removed. A very tired hotel that needs major upgrading. The furniture had seen better days, the carpet needed changing not cleaning. The photos of the hotel looked good but they were misleading. The staff were okay but they can only work with what they got. It was centrally located and that was good because but you would not want to spend much time in your room. Florence is a beautiful city but the hotel put a sour note to our holiday time.
Reviews.Author: bordercrossing

Reviews.Content: Great location but...       Carpet between the beds
Reviews.Author: amuro

Reviews.Content: Look else where! We were stuck with this hotel on the easter long weekend. Dark, dingy, water damaged floorings, a terrible breakfast and surly reception staff , need I say more. Look closer to the railway station on Via Faenza, there a lot of good hotels like Azzi-locanda Degli Artis.
Reviews.Author: Aroborus

Reviews.Content: Great Little Hotel I find this site very useful so I thought I would write my first review. I found this hotel clean and adequate for a short stay of four nights. It doesn't have the latest Mod Cons, but then again if your going to central Florence expecting modern buildings you are going to the wrong place.With regard to the noise , this must depend upon the location of the room. Our room was at the back of the hotel (no view) and we never heard a sound - night or day. Being partial to a Pint or two of the Black Stuff I found the Irish Bar a blessing!The Hotel is well located: close to the main sites and market and a 5 minute walk to the train station (aviod this area at night).The Hotel has limited facilities but the rooms were clean and the staff courteous and friendly. Want more pay more?
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: No sleep in Florence The hotel is a tired. The capet and wallcovering is old and in need of updating.Bathrooms are poor by all standards. The staff is friendly and helpful. The biggest problem is the noise level in the evening. Threre is a Irish bar across the street and a Brazilan disco next door. If you don't mind waiting until 4:00am to go to sleep. This hotel is right for you!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Dear Hotel San Giorgio... thank you so much I would like to thank you for providing such a nice place to stay while we visited Florence last week. Our room number 407 was perfect and the balcony was an unexpected bonus and the perfect vantage point from which to enjoy the beautiful panoramic skyline of Florence. Everyone at the hotel was professional, polite and friendly, ultimately this helped make our first trip to Florence and Italy a big success. We will certainly return to your hotel and will recommend it to our friends and relatives. Keep up the good work.
Reviews.Author: normclark12

Reviews.Content: Rolling Rolling Rolling Rex is Really Rocking i love this hotel! true it is a little old but so what you are in Florence... true the owners Mr and Mrs Lodovichi do lounge around the TV room watching mind numbing tv shows but so what this is their hotel and the fact that they were there from wednesday to friday shows that they care about their hotel and its' guests! The hotel's biggest plus point is the location which is superb as you can literally fall out of bed slap bang bump right into the middle of the Historical Centre of Florence. The rooms don't rock instead they creak but that is simply because the building is so old... The hotel is full of Florentine Character and you will have a superb time chatting to Paolo and the other evening receptionists who are only too willing to help you with your evening's entertainment. I will definitely return to the Hotel Rex.
Reviews.Author: georgieboy12

Reviews.Content: No-Star Hotel Internet pix of Hotel Rex are totally misleading. The wallpaper and carpet are badly stained. The room AC is ineffective. The bathroom is just a large shower with a curtain between the floor drain and the toilet/bidet. Maintenance and redecoration seem to have been deferred permanently. The staff are demoralized. Worst hotel I鈥檝e seen since the night I spent in a fleabag for a college sociology course on homelessness.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Little Gem       View from Fiesole - it's worth the bus ride
Reviews.Author: Footsie

Reviews.Content: Small and noisy We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July 2005. The hotel was very close to the train station, so we found the hotel easily by foot.The rooms were small, with a tiny bathroom. The shower flooded the bathroom easily, so bath-slippers were needed. The view from the window was a dirty alley, and provided no light for the room. On the other hand, the air conditioner worked fine and there was a refridgerator as well. We could easily hear our neighbours. At the time we were there, there was also a lot of loud youths who kept yelling and running in the hallways. We wished the reception could speak up, on behalf of all the guests who got disturbed. In the reception there were only older men, but they spoke very good English.We will not recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Avoid Hotel Rex We selected Hotel Rex mainly for the good rate and location in proximity to the train station. After confirming our rate a few weeks prior, we arrived at the hotel and checked in. The accommodations were a bit dismal - our room was tiny and needed some cleaning. The TV did not work and the shower flooded the bathroom. But we were in Florence and did not plan to spend much time in the room. After two nights I went to check out only to find that we were being charged a higher rate than quoted. The gentlemen who had confirmed my reservation and rate was now quoting me a rate significantly higher. He stated that he had to pay commission to two travel agents for the room reservation and that is why the rate was higher. I did not understand this, seeing that he had quoted me the lower rate and I had a PRINT OUT of the email. He still wouldn't budge and I left paying the higher rate but very disappointed. Avoid this place - there are much better options in Florence for the same amount of money.
Reviews.Author: V-T

Reviews.Content: Hotel Rex Rocks even if a Little Old Cute little hotel right in the centre of things... you are minutes walk from the Duomo and all of Florence's major attractions. In addition the street market of San Lorenzo is just round the corner (don't buy any leather items here as I saw one of the traders spray a jacket with some leather smelling perfume). I liked the Rex and found it be the best value for money hotel in Florence for its' category... (i shopped around alot) We paid 120 euro for a double room(booked through the hotel's own website) and it was worth every cent. Breakfast was a bit sparse but it was so hot outside that we didn't want to eat that much anyway. The rooms are a little tired looking but are clean and have basic facilities such as private bathroom (shower and tub) plus satelite tv (cnn), mini bar and a safety deposit box.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Fond memories of the Rex We were anxious about staying here after reading some reviews on this website, and it's true that this place takes some getting used to. But the rooms were clean, and the beds very comfortable. And the location really is excellent: you can get to so many important sites in just a few minutes. By the way, although some have complained about The Rex's nearness to the Dublin Pub, we didn't find any problems with late-night noise. In fact, that Irish bar is a great place to wind down after a day of sightseeing and dining: good service and nice people. Also, there's a fine restaurant just across the street from the Rex--Antellesi, via Faenza #9--run by a very nice couple named Jo and Rene. Finally, the staff at the Hotel Rex was terrific: they were cordial and willing to meet all of our requests. We'd definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: fantastic, clean hotel, great breakfast, prime location,afordable A great location, fantastic staff, clean, walking distance to all important locations, with affordable price.I will recommend it to anyone looking for a budget hotel to Florence. Quiet and peaceful. Safe.
Reviews.Author: travellerwithfamily

Reviews.Content: Value for Money and Great Location to boot! for only 70 euro a double room per night (including a moderate continental buffet breakfast) the Rex is excellent value for money. The location next to the bustling street market of San Lorenzo is ideal for those who want to be in the middle of the historical centre of Florence (the Duomo and Giotto's Belltower are only 3 minutes walk away) I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a low budget!
Reviews.Author: lingo

Reviews.Content: Good situation! Hotel Rex is next to St. Lorenzo Church, and 2 min. walking from Duomo. We spent there 2 nights.The room was clean and the breakfast buffet was O.K. The staff was nice.You have a parking(20鈧?day) close to the hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best to be used just as a pit stop The room was very small and in desperate need of decoration however if you looked passed the peeling wallpaper and dislodged ceiling tiles it was as clean as possible. The bathroom was again small, required decoration however clean. No power shower but the mains powered shower did the job. I can understand why the other reports on this hotel are poor, as the 3 star rating is a bit surprising however if you just want a clean bed to put your head down in every night that isn't going to cost a fortune go for it. We only had 3 days in Florence so we didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the room anyway Our room was at the front of the hotel overlooking the Irish bar it was a bit noisy so if you're a light sleeper request a room at the back of the hotel or bring earplugs.Breakfast was a typical continental breakfast just basic no thrills tea/coffee, cereals, croissants, rolls, preserves and tinned fruit.The main thing this hotel has going for it is the location, its central to all the main places of interest with just a 3 min walk from the Cathedral if that.On summary I would say go to this hotel just don't go with any great expectations.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Never stay in this hotel What can i say about this sewer? The only thing i happy about that we stayed in this place only 4 nights. This place highly NOT recommended for visitors. Service is BAD, rooms are old and dirty. Save your money and stay away from this sewer. I really don't understand who can give 3* for this .... Sorry for abnormal words, but i'm really upset.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Don't stay here We had a triple here. Don't waste your money on this dump. The shower was like a flood, the staff was not friendly (always a big deal with the minor of requests), and I almost threw up on the breakfast because the butter was old. The safe is in the wall could be easily accessed--didn't give me the warm and fuzzies of leaving everything we owned in there. If you pay over 100聙 a night for this place you are getting ripped off. We paid double that and were not at all happy. It doesn't make a difference to fight with them since the hospitality they exhibited was not good. Florence is a major tourist trap, food is very expensive for little portions-- two slices of pizza and 2 beers at one place costs 46聙 near the Ponte Vecchio (watch out before you sit down). They look at you like money bags so be careful before you open up your wallet, always ask the price and pay before taking a sip or a bite, or else you could end up with a tremendous bill. Just some helpful tips on Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
